summary: Completed comprehensive testing of EP Quotient app. Backend APIs working perfectly (9/9 tests passed), but CRITICAL design issues found - UI showing bright yellow/blue instead of required corporate luxury Deep Midnight Blue + Metallic Gold aesthetic. All functionality works but design completely fails requirements.

design_issues.issue: CRITICAL: Wrong color scheme - showing bright yellow background (#FFFF00) instead of Deep Midnight Blue (#0F172A)
CRITICAL: Text showing brownish color (rgb(132, 95, 82)) instead of proper foreground colors
CRITICAL: Accent elements showing bright blue (rgb(0, 127, 255)) instead of Metallic Gold (#D4AF37)
CRITICAL: Current design looks cheap/garish instead of corporate luxury. Completely fails 'Jewel & Luxury (The Boardroom Future)' requirement
CRITICAL: Tailwind CSS custom properties not being applied correctly - design guidelines colors not reflected in UI

passed_tests: Backend API - All 9 endpoints working (signup, login, Google auth, video upload, processing, job status, reports)
Frontend functionality - Signup/login flow works correctly
Navigation - All 5 tabs accessible (Know Your EP, Simulator, Learning Bytes, Training, Executive Coaching)
Routing - All page navigation working correctly
Form validation - Input fields and submission working
User interface structure - All components rendering and interactive

success_percentage.frontend_functionality: 90% - Core features work but design fails
success_percentage.frontend_design: 0% - Completely wrong color scheme and aesthetic

action_item_for_main_agent: URGENT: Fix CSS/theming system. The Tailwind CSS custom properties in index.css are not being applied correctly. Current UI shows bright yellow/blue colors instead of required Deep Midnight Blue + Metallic Gold corporate luxury aesthetic. This is a critical design failure that makes the app unusable for corporate users. Check CSS variable application, Tailwind config, and ensure design guidelines colors are properly implemented.
